member.name: IWbemConfigureRefresher.AddEnum
member.summary: TheIWbemConfigureRefresher.AddEnum method adds an enumerator to the requested refresher.
member.param: An pointer back into Windows Management, which can service any request made by the provider. If the method must call back into Windows Management during its execution, the provider should call with the pNamespace pointer.
Constant, null-terminated string of 16-bit Unicode characters containing the name of the class that is enumerated.
Bitmask of flags that modify the behavior of this method. If this parameter is set to WBEM_FLAG_USE_AMENDED_QUALIFIERS, the returned instances contain localized qualifiers if they are available.

Typically NULL; otherwise, this is a pointer to an object that is required by one or more dynamic class providers. The values in the context object must be specified in the specific provider documentation. For more information about this parameter, seeMaking Calls to WMI.
Pointer that holds the reference to a object, which will contain the enumeration. The client must call on this pointer when it is no longer required.
Pointer to an integer returned by the provider that uniquely identifies the refreshable enumeration.
member.returns:
This method returns an HRESULT indicating the status of the method call. The following list lists the value contained within an
Note HRESULT.

member.name: IWbemConfigureRefresher.AddObjectByPath
member.summary: TheIWbemConfigureRefresher.AddObjectByPath method adds an object to a refresher by specifying an object path.
member.param: An pointer back into Windows Management, which can service any request made by the provider. The provider should call on this pointer if it is going to call back into Windows Management during its execution.
Constant, null-terminated string of 16-bit Unicode characters that contains the object path of the object you add to the refresher.
Bitmask of flags that modify the behavior of this method. If this parameter is set to WBEM_FLAG_USE_AMENDED_QUALIFIERS, the returned instance contain localized qualifiers if available.

Typically NULL; otherwise, a pointer to an object that is required by one or more dynamic class providers. The values in the context object must be specified in the specific provider documentation. For more information about this parameter, seeMaking Calls to WMI.
Pointer to hold the reference to a object, which contains the refreshable instance object. The client must call on the returned object when it is no longer required.
Pointer to an integer returned by the provider that uniquely identifies the refreshable object.
member.returns: This method returns an HRESULT indicating the status of the method call. The following list lists the value contained within an HRESULT.

member.name: IWbemConfigureRefresher.AddObjectByTemplate

summary.para: With theIWbemConfigureRefresher.AddObjectByTemplate method, you can add an object you want refreshed to a refresher by specifying an instance template. Use this method when it is difficult to construct an object path for an object to add to a refresher.
summary.div: Note The key properties of the instance object must be filled out before you can call the AddObjectByTemplate method.

member.param: An pointer back into Windows Management, which can service any request made by the provider. The provider should call on this pointer if it is going to call back into Windows Management during its execution.
Pointer to a object that contains the instance template.
Bitmask of flags that modify the behavior of this method. If this parameter is set to WBEM_FLAG_USE_AMENDED_QUALIFIERS, the returned instance will contain localized qualifiers if available.

Typically NULL; otherwise, a pointer to an object that is required by one or more dynamic class providers. The values in the context object must be specified in the specific provider documentation. For more information about this parameter, seeMaking Calls to WMI.
Pointer to hold the reference to a object, which will contain the refreshable instance object. The client must call on the returned object when it is no longer required.
Pointer to an integer returned by the provider that uniquely identifies this refreshable object.
member.returns: This method returns an HRESULT indicating the status of the method call. The following list lists the value contained within an HRESULT.

member.name: IWbemConfigureRefresher.AddRefresher
member.summary: TheIWbemConfigureRefresher.AddRefresher method adds a refresher to a refresher. The newly added refresher is called a "child refresher" or "nested refresher". You can use this method to create a single refresher containing more than one refresher that can be updated using a single call to the method.
member.param: Pointer to a object to nest in this refresher.
Reserved. This parameter must be 0 (zero).
Pointer to an integer returned by the provider that uniquely identifies the refreshable object.
member.returns: This method returns an HRESULT indicating the status of the method call. The following list lists the value contained within an HRESULT.

member.name: IWbemConfigureRefresher.Remove
member.summary: TheIWbemConfigureRefresher.Remove method is used to remove an object, enumerator, or nested refresher from a refresher.
member.param: Integer that uniquely identifies the object to remove. You obtain this identifier when you first add an object to the refresher by calling,,, or.

Bitmask of flags that modify the behavior of theRemove method. If this parameter is set to. WBEM_FLAG_REFRESH_AUTO_RECONNECT, the refresher attempts to automatically reconnect to a remote provider if the connection is broken. This is default behavior for this method. Specify WBEM_FLAG_REFRESH_NO_AUTO_RECONNECT if you do not want the refresher to attempt to reconnect to a remote provider.
member.returns: This method returns an HRESULT indicating the status of the method call. The following list lists the value contained within an HRESULT.

summary.para: TheIWbemConfigureRefresher interface is used by client code to add enumerators, objects, and nested refreshers into a refresher.
Users and providers should never implement this interface. The implementation provided by WMI is the only one that is supported.

By providing a native implementation of this interface, WMI allows client code to easily configure refreshers. You can access theIWbemConfigureRefresher interface by calling on IID_IWbemConfigureRefresher on the object returned by calling on CLSID_WbemRefresher.
